title: How To Introduce A New Hen To The Hen House

tasks.task: Introduce a new hen to the hen house.
subtasks: Obtain a large wire dog crate.
Place the new hen in the wire crate.
Position the crate in the chicken run adjacent to the hen house.
Allow the existing chickens to observe the new hen from outside the crate for several days.
After three days, open the crate door and let the new hen exit when she is ready.

tasks.task: Introduce a new rooster to the hens.
subtasks: Consider using a wire crate or fence to initially separate the new rooster from the hens.
Gradually acclimate the rooster to the hens' presence by allowing supervised interactions.
Provide the rooster with access to the hen house and run, ensuring safety.
Calculate daily water intake based on body weight in ounces (half the weight).
Monitor water consumption to meet the requirement.
